newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian minister confirms Busang deadline.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian minister confirms Busang deadline.

text.p: Mines and Energy Minister Ida Bagus Sudjana said Indonesia will seek investors in the huge Busang gold find if Canada's Bre-X Minerals Ltd and Barrick Gold Corp. fail to meet a February deadline.

"Surely yes," he said Thursday night when asked if the government would look for other investors if Bre-X and Barrick failed to settle with local partners within the one month given by his ministry from Jan. 17.

Sudjana also did not dismiss the possibility of Placer Dome Inc. of Canada being involved in the development of the find, estimated by Bre-X to contain at least 57 million ounces of gold worth over $21 billion at current prices.
"There is a possibility," he said when asked if Placer could be involved in developing the property.
Placer has proposed a $5 billion merger with Bre-X and offered up to 40 percent of the property to Indonesian interests, including the government.

Indonesian mining officials had earlier raised concerns over Placer's environmental credentials because of its involvement in the Marcopper copper mine in the Philippines, which suffered a major tailings leak in March, 1996, polluting a local river.
Placer wrote off its investment in Marcopper last year and took a $43 million charge to earnings for the accident.
The Mines and Energy Ministry wrote to Bre-X and Barrick on Jan. 17 telling them to settle with their local partners within one month or everything discussed previously would be cancelled.
A ministry official told Reuters Thursday that if the companies failed to meet the deadline, the government was prepared to take control of the property.
